sources.title: The Next of Kin
sources.description: “Surprisingly candid propaganda” “A war film of rare authenticity” “The film Winston Churchill wanted to ban” “Spying, training, combat action -- this film has them all” (IMDB reviews quotes). A compelling government-produced action-docudrama which effectively shows how careless words at home can lead to combat losses overseas. Excellent cast and production. National Board of Review Top Ten Films List for 1943. IMDB rating 6.9. Directed by Thorold Dickinson. UK release 1942. US release 1943. Complete print (PAL transfer) NOTE: Fortunately for the British and us World War II German espionage usually proved to be much less competent and effective than depicted in this film.

sources.title: The Next of Kin
sources.description: Title: The Next of Kin Summary: Wartime propaganda piece giving the warning "Be like Dad, Keep Mum". A gossipy housewife is overheard talking about what her son is doing by a Nazi spy. Directed by: Thorold Dickinson Actors: Mervyn Johns, John Chandos, Nova Pilbeam Production Company: Ealing Studios Release Date: 15 June 1942 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Wartime propaganda piece giving the warning "Be like Dad, Keep Mum". A gossipy housewife is overheard talking about what her son is doing by a Nazi spy.

metadata.Plot: A woman's idle remark about her son has devastating consequences when she is overheard by a nazi spy. Thorold Dickinson's eerily credible account of Fifth Column activity started life as a propaganda short, only to be expanded (at the MOI's behest) into a feature on the dangers of careless talk.
metadata.Writer: Thorold Dickinson, Basil Bartlett, Angus MacPhail
metadata.Actors: Mervyn Johns, John Chandos, Nova Pilbeam
